snippet.title: Syrian activists accuse Assad of new gas attacks
snippet.description: Syrian government forces have attacked rebel-held areas with poisonous chlorine gas in recent weeks and months, leaving men, women and children coughing, choking and gasping for breath, according to Associated Press interviews with more than a dozen activists, medics and residents on the opposition side.

snippet.title: Fears of chemical weapons attacks in Syria
UN seeks probe of alleged chlorine gas in Syria
snippet.description: The U.N. Security Council called for an investigation Wednesday into reports of alleged chlorine gas use in some Syrian towns, causing deaths and injuries.

snippet.title: Syria President Bashar al-Assad's confident call for elections
snippet.description: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad calls for elections, confident in another term.

snippet.title: Expert: Syria has dumped 86 pc of chemical weapons
snippet.description: Syria's government has disposed of more than 86 percent of its total chemical weapons stockpile, according to the watchdog agency charged with overseeing its removal.

snippet.title: U.S. cites 'indications' toxic chemical was used in Syria attack
snippet.description: Government and rebels trade accusations over who was behind possible use of chemical.

snippet.title: AP News in Brief at 10:58 p.m. EDT
snippet.description: Syrian activists, medics accuse Assad government of chlorine gas attacks; Syria denies it

snippet.title: Editorial Roundup: Excerpts from recent editorials
snippet.description: Excerpts from recent editorials in newspapers in the United States and abroad:

snippet.title: The U.S. must stand behind its security obligations
snippet.description: A world that doubts the U.S.'s allegiance is a dangerous one.

snippet.title: US looking into possible chemical attack in Syria
snippet.description: The U.S. is looking into whether a toxic chemical was deployed in areas of Syria that are controlled by rebel forces seeking to oust Syrian President Bashar Assad (bah-SHAR' AH'-sahd).
